item.title: Webscraping NHL Data with RSelenium, Part 1
item.description: I love hockey. I also love data science. Whatâ€™s better than merging the two and learn how to use RSelenium in the process? A while ago, I wrote some web-scraping code to find the NHL standings as of Novermber 1st (roughtly one month into the season). I was doing this in order to determine if a strong start to the season was related to end-of-season success. Fortunately, the website dropyourgloves.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min.
